‚ÄúThey are planning a project & she wanted to know if we preferred Charlie make art for a grandma or have private play time #inclusion #EqualityForAll #gaydads,‚Äù he continued.
It was a reassuring moment for their first ‚ÄúMother‚Äôs Day‚Äù as a family.
Mother‚Äôs Day can be fraught for many reasons for many people. There are blended, foster and grandparent-led families and homes where other loving people have stepped into mothering roles who often go unacknowledged. And there are plenty of families out there like the Loduca-Smiths ‚Äì between 2 million and 3.7 million children under age 18 have an LGBTQ parent, and approximately 200,000 of them are being raised by a same-sex couple.
But some circumstances can be particularly difficult. Kids, or their mothers, may be grieving a death, or separated because of illness, addiction , or incarceration. For kids, parents, and caregivers who are bombarded by messages of ‚Äútraditional‚Äù motherhood and Mother‚Äôs Day activities at school, corporate daycare, and at church, it can be particularly isolating.
Brands are starting to notice.
This year, Teleflora has launched an emotional ad campaign called ‚ÄúLove Makes a Mom,‚Äù a series of minute-long vignettes created by the in-house marketing agency of Teleflora parent, The Wonderful Company.
One story is about a black, lesbian couple with an adorable daughter, who are all thriving despite the judgments of others. Another is about an Army veteran and entrepreneur who is raising her fifteen-year-old half-sister. ‚ÄúOur mother has come in and out of both our lives,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAnd if you‚Äôve gone through something that‚Äôs not great, you don‚Äôt want it to happen to other people.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis Mother‚Äôs Day we‚Äôre seeing retailers win over consumers with impactful campaigns that breakdown the traditional constructs of Mother‚Äôs Day as a greeting card holiday, and instead focus on the themes and topics their audience, mothers and families, cares about most,‚Äù says Kristin Johnson, the communications director at Sprout Social, a venture-backed social media management platform. ‚ÄúBrands realize that safe, traditional campaigns ensure no one will be offended, but they also ensure you won‚Äôt create a devoted customer base.‚Äù
The Teleflora campaign has been mentioned in nearly 4,500 Mother‚Äôs Day messages on Twitter alone.
But however families are configured, Mother‚Äôs Day is a reminder that the best way to know what people need is to ask them.
‚ÄúInclusion can live in big programs and small gestures ‚Äî and it‚Äôs usually quiet moments like this that stick with you the most,‚Äù Loduca and Smith told raceAhead via email. ‚Äú Mother‚Äôs Day can provoke anxiety for gay dads, and it only took 30 seconds for someone to reaffirm our family. We‚Äôll never forget it.‚Äù
And neither will Loduca‚Äôs own mother, who, spoiler alert, will be getting Charlie‚Äôs first-ever handmade Mother‚Äôs Day card.

A recent survey from New York Life shows the overwhelming impact that the loss of a parent has on children before the age of 20, and offers helpful suggestions on how to check in and support them during difficult holidays or anniversaries.

National Black Mama‚Äôs Bail Out Day , established last year, raises money to help bail out incarcerated black mothers so they can spend the holiday with their children. According to The Atlantic , some 60 percent of people in U.S. jails have yet to go to trial, and around nine in ten people remain incarcerated simply because they can‚Äôt afford bail.
